Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a light-brown coloured pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, with faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text on the exterior, identifying the contents as wine and naming the head vintner Pahu.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 17
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393121) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393121)
